reviews.review:
With all the hype around the MCU many wondered if this latest installment would be a let down, especially coming off the heels of Black Panther, the most successful movie in the MCU. 

Well, you can put those fears to bed as Avengers: Infinity War not only lives up to the hype, but is the Avengers movie you've been waiting for since the first one in 2012. With stunning action, amazing characters and an fantastic cinematography, its clear to see that Marvel Studios show no signs of slowing down anytime soon. All the characters are amazing, but none more so than Josh Brolin as the Mad Titan Thanos, the villain of the movie and he was well worth the wait. Thanos steals the movie in so many ways. The emotion he makes you feel isn't like your stereo typical, 'I want to rule the universe' villain, Thanos was impressive from the first moment you see him on screen until the very end. And Brolin was magnificent making the Mad Titan the best MCU villain ever. He truly is the unstoppable monster that he's been built up to since the Avengers in 2012. 

The comedy was fantastic as well. And it was all properly placed. When the film needed to be serious, it was, and when it needed to be dark, it was, and it was done marvelously. The Russo Brothers proved before they could find a balance between so many characters with The Guardians of the Galaxy joining The Avengers in this latest film, but it never felt overwhelming. Yes, there will be characters you will want to see more of, but that's what Avengers 4 is for. XD

My final verdict is that Avengers Infinity Was is a 5 star must see film. Its a move ten years in the making, and with how well its done, its obvious to see why.
Shock value does not equate to good writing.

This movie is great, especially considering how much build up and work Marvel has put in over the past 10 years to get here. It balances its large cast incredibly well given the sheer number of characters and ground it has to cover. It subverts your expectations in a pleasant way, and you realize that even the trailers have intentional misdirection to hide details from you before you go in. 

Of course this movie is not perfect, a few too many jokes at inappropriate times, and some characters don't get as much time to shine as one may hope for. Given how the story is dealing with infinity stones, it's getting to the territory of time travel movies where thinking about certain plot points can ruin the magic. 

This movie is probably the darkest of all the Marvel movies, and it is a nice change of pace from the other films we've seen over the past 10 years.

While this movie spends no time developing the heroes (that's what the previous films were for), it does spend time developing Thanos into a villain that is interesting to watch and actually intimidating.

Would highly recommend watching this movie, although if you are new to the Marvel universe a lot of things won't make sense.
I have seen the movie and It was awesome

This movie was amazing it deserves more then 5 stars. Critics will always give bad reviews  to good movies. I never listen to critic reviews only audience reviews. 94% speaks for it's self. And some say it had no plot. Pretty sure they spent 10 years setting up the plot. Again best movie I have seen to date.

Wow, I was actually really impressed at how well they used all the characters. I thought the humour was a nice balance to all the sad and serious moments in the movie. I certainly knew would be tough ending considering there’s a second part coming out next year. I am looking forward to the resolution.
Well Done! Honestly you have to rewatch this movie again to understand what Thanos purpose was! Great in every way but only wish they didn’t try to pack so much into one movie

Part one of this two part epic is a non stop roller coaster ride, that drops down it's biggest, scariest hill right at the very end. It's a very long, and fun ride until you reach that last bit. Which may be too steep for some riders to handle.
A totally different movie from superheroes, it's like you're reading a comic

Better than I was expecting.  Mostly fun with some bold choices thrown in (Although I know the producers are going to pussy out and backtrack on those in the next one, as they always do)  The villain is actually somewhat interesting for once, which is shocking for Marvel.  Yeah, decent.  Far too long and repetitive though.  I can't watch one more person get punched through a wall.
